Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This must be a unique number, and could be a compound identifier formed by concatenating STUDYID-SITEID-SUBJID.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.SUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
datasetVariables.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFSTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Reference Start Date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment. See Assumption 9 for additional detail on when RFSTDTC may be null.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time
datasetVariables.name: RFSTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Reference End Date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to the date/time when subject was determined to have ended the trial, and often equivalent to date/time of last exposure to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Reference End Date/Time
datasetVariables.name: RFENDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFXSTDTC

datasetVariables.description: First date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the earliest value of EXSTDTC.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: RFXSTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFXENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Last date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the latest value of EXENDTC (or the latest value of EXSTDTC if EXENDTC was not collected or is missing).
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: RFXENDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFICDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented. Would be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Informed Consent
datasetVariables.name: RFICDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RFPENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time when subject ended participation or follow-up in a trial, as defined in the protocol, in ISO 8601 character format. Should correspond to the last known date of contact. Examples include completion date, withdrawal date, last follow-up, date recorded for lost to follow up, or death date.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of End of Participation
datasetVariables.name: RFPENDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.DTHDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO 8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Death
datasetVariables.name: DTHDTC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicates the subject died. Should be "Y" or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Death Flag
datasetVariables.name: DTHFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.SITEID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a site within a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Site Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.INVID

datasetVariables.description: An identifier to describe the Investigator for the study. May be used in addition to SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID.
datasetVariables.label: Investigator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: INVID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.INVNAM

datasetVariables.description: Name of the investigator for a site.
datasetVariables.label: Investigator Name
datasetVariables.name: INVNAM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.BRTHDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of birth of the subject.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Birth
datasetVariables.name: BRTHDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.AGE

datasetVariables.description: Age expressed in AGEU. May be derived from RFSTDTC and BRTHDTC, but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns).
datasetVariables.label: Age
datasetVariables.name: AGE

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66781

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.AGEU

datasetVariables.description: Units associated with AGE.
datasetVariables.label: Age Units
datasetVariables.name: AGEU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66731

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.SEX

datasetVariables.description: Sex of the subject.
datasetVariables.label: Sex
datasetVariables.name: SEX

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74457

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.RACE

datasetVariables.description: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, October, 2016) for guidance regarding the collection of race (https://www.fda.gov/downloads/regulatoryinformation/guidances/ucm126396.pdf) See Assumption below regarding RACE.
datasetVariables.label: Race
datasetVariables.name: RACE

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66790

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ETHNIC

datasetVariables.description: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, October, 2016) for guidance regarding the collection of ethnicity (https://www.fda.gov/downloads/regulatoryinformation/guidances/ucm126396.pdf).
datasetVariables.label: Ethnicity
datasetVariables.name: ETHNIC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ARMCD

datasetVariables.description:
ARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD.The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a seven-period crossover were constructed using two-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. If the subject was not assigned to an Arm, ARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated.
With the exception of studies which use multi-stage Arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms Dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ARM

datasetVariables.description:
Name of the Arm to which the subject was assigned. If the subject was not assigned to an Arm, ARM is null and ARMNRS is populated.
With the exception of studies which use multi-stage Arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms Dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ACTARMCD

datasetVariables.description:
Code of actual Arm. ACTARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD. The maximum length of ACTARMCD is longer than for other short variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials.
With the exception of studies which use multi-stage Arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms Dataset.
If the subject was not assigned to an Arm or followed a course not described by any planned Arm, ACTARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated.
datasetVariables.label: Actual Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ACTARMCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ACTARM

datasetVariables.description:
Description of actual Arm.
With the exception of studies which use multi-stage Arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms Dataset.
If the subject was not assigned to an Arm or followed a course not described by any planned Arm, ACTARM is null and ARMNRS is populated.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Actual Arm
datasetVariables.name: ACTARM

modelDatasetVariable.title: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ARMNRS

self.title: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null

datasetVariables.description: A coded reason that Arm variables (ARM and ARMCD) and/or actual Arm variables (ACTARM and ACTARMCD) are null. Examples: "SCREEN FAILURE", "NOT ASSIGNED", "ASSIGNED, NOT TREATED", "UNPLANNED TREATMENT". It is assumed that if the Arm and actual Arm variables are null, the same reason applies to both Arm and actual Arm.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null
datasetVariables.name: ARMNRS

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.ACTARMUD

datasetVariables.description: A description of actual treatment for a subject who did not receive treatment described in one of the planned trial Arms.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Unplanned Actual Arm
datasetVariables.name: ACTARMUD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.COUNTRY

datasetVariables.description: Country of the investigational site in which the subject participated in the trial.
datasetVariables.label: Country
datasetVariables.name: COUNTRY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.DMDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of demographic data collection.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Collection
datasetVariables.name: DMDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DM.DMDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of collection measured as integer days.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Collection
datasetVariables.name: DMDY

description: A special-purpose domain that includes a set of essential standard variables that describe each subject in a clinical study. It is the parent domain for all other observations for human clinical subjects. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49572, 2018-06-29)
label: Demographics
name: DM
